meanings.definition: To reduce the size or scale of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to start downscaling her wardrobe by donating old clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company is downscaling its operations to focus on core products.
meanings.sent3: After downscaling her massive book collection, she finally had space for a reading nook.
meanings.sent4: The artist skillfully downscaling the mural to fit the small gallery wall.
meanings.sent5: The chef demonstrated downscaling the recipe for a single serving.

meanings.definition: The act of making something smaller or less significant.
meanings.sent1: The downscaling of the project led to cost savings for the company.
meanings.sent2: Downscaling of the event resulted in fewer attendees than expected.
meanings.sent3: The downscaling of his role in the play turned out to be a comedic highlight.
meanings.sent4: The downscaling of the mountain in the painting symbolized humility.
meanings.sent5: The downscaling of the font made the text easier to read on the poster.
